results.title: Houses in history
results.creator_credit: H.M. Nieter, Paul Rotha and Seven-League Unit
results.brief_description: The different kinds of material used for building in the British Isles and their influence on construction are studied, with a brief survey of the development of houses in England from the 13th century until today.

results.title: Houses have history
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Children look at old buildings and their features in and around San Francisco/Sacramento, USA. Examines how a neighbourhood has changed and the growing interest in preserving and renovating old buildings. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Houses Fit for People
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part Eight of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Eight deals with domestic housing. Most famous architects are concerned with commercial and institutional architecture. Ordinary people have to live in “junk” but there are signs that housing design is undergoing a change for the better. In the suburbs of Paris and London, a more humane architecture is beginning to emerge which challenges the monotony of the “new town” ideal.

results.title: House: after five years of living
results.brief_description: The first of a certain thread of films by Charles and Ray Eames that used still images in a very filmic way. The still camera offered a freedom and flexibility that allowed Charles and Ray to capture lyrical images of their house, its garden and its decor and to provide a lasting impression of the house during their life there. The house is a classic of post-war American architecture which the Eameses designed and built in 1949 as part of the Case Study House Program. Music composed by Elmer Bernstein. Performed by Martin Ruderman (flute), Dorothy Remsen (harp), Armand Kaproff (cello) and Elmer Bernstein (piano).

results.title: House with a secret
results.brief_description: The story of a girl who finds a wallet outside an old house and takes it inside, but the house is deserted and untidy except for one room with presents in it. She hears a bridal couple and their friends arriving and rushes down to give the wallet to them, but they brush past her. She walks sadly outside and places the wallet where she found it, but picks up the bride’s posy in return and skips away with it in her hair.

results.title: House that Jack built
results.brief_description: An information film on the operation of the Local Building Trade Apprenticeship Scheme in England. Shows high school students working as laborers at a housing project construction site as part of a work experience scheme.

results.title: House of treasures: the magic eye
results.brief_description: Illustrates the development of photographic technology through an exposition of archival photos of colonial Australia. Reveals some of the techniques and processes used in early photographic work, and highlights several old cameras. Quaint and static in its exploration of historical depiction of idiomatic Australia. Narrated by Noel Brophy.

results.title: House of knowledge
results.creator_credit: Larry O'Reilly and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: A panoramic study of the Smithsonian Institution, which supplies its immense collection of art and museum pieces largely by its own exploration and searching. Mentions briefly ethnology, biology, entomology and other sciences - giving glimpses of work in each field. Shows field teams investigating a new volcano, and archaeologists in Mexico.

results.title: House in the jungle
results.creator_credit: John Power and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of a group of peasants from central Java to a new settlement in Sumatra in an official migration scheme, showing some of Indonesia’s national problems of economic and political life incidentally.
